entry.title: Transcripts from coredev.tech Amsterdam 2019 meeting
entry.summary: In an email thread, Bryan Bishop shared notes from the coredev.tech Amsterdam 2019 meeting. The notes cover a range of topics discussed during the meeting, including the code review process in Bitcoin Core, problems faced by maintainers, wallet re-architecture, consensus cleanup, SIGHASH_NOINPUT, OP_CHECKSIGFROMSTACK, OP_CHECKOUTPUTSHASHVERIFY, and OP_SECURETHEBAG, Taproot discussion, Utreexo, assumeutxo, hardware wallets and HWI, bip151, p2p encryption and v2 message format, Signet for bitcoin test networks, and Statechains overview. All the links to the transcripts of these discussions are provided in the email. Cory replied with a belated thank you for the notes, which she found valuable.
